abstract: Profile of Bernhardt Wichmann III, Korean War veteran who lost his voice in 1983; examines friendships mute New Yorker forged with two doormen, Jorge Grisales and Juan Arias, who worked in buildings near Upper East Side single-room-occupancy residence that was his home for decades.
lead_paragraph: Bernhardt Wichmann III, a Korean War veteran, possessed little except a big heart, and he spread kindness up and down his street on the Upper East Side of Manhattan.

headline.main: Mute and Alone, He Was Never Short of Kind Words or Friends
headline.print_headline: He Lost His Voice, but His Spirit Spoke Volumes

snippet: Bernhardt Wichmann III, a Korean War veteran, possessed little except a big heart, and he spread kindness up and down his street on the Upper East Side of Manhattan....
